pages.text: You have grown so much in a short amount of time, we we're impressed by your performance in the first $(item)Simulation$().$(br2)Your next task is to create a $(item)Primitive Power System$() that will power a $(item)Squeezer$().
You can use the $(item)Steel$() you've manufactured to create a $(item)Kinetic Dynamo$().$(br2)You can attach a $(item)Water Wheel$() or a $(item)Windmill$() to the dynamo to create kinetic power.

pages.title: Primitive Power
pages.text: Now the connecting the $(item)Wires$() and transferring the $(item)Energy$() is a bit more tricky.$(br2)Our technological revolution was stalled numerous times and we often had to turn to $(item)Magic$() to solve the next hurdle.$(br2)Our most primitive energy connectors that we managed to work was laced with the charred feathers of$(br)$(l:sim_2/inhabitants)Blood Ravens$().

You need to go slay some of the $(l:sim_2/inhabitants)Ravens$() for their feathers, bring them back and run them through the $(item)Blast furnace$().$(br2)Then you need to construct the $(item)Alloy Kiln$() multiblock and alloy the charred feathers with some seared bricks.

pages.title: Alloy Kiln Materials
pages.notes: $(item)Right click$() on the correct side with an $(item)Engineers Hammer$() to assemble once the structure is placed.$(br2)Don't forget to use $(l:portal_hub/4_schematica)Schematica$() if you're unsure of how to build the multiblock.

pages.text: After you use the $(item)Alloy Kiln$() to make $(item)Charred Terracotta$() you can assemble the connectors you need to transfer power.

pages.title: Preheaters
pages.text: You could use this early power to attach a set of preheaters to your $(item)Blast Furnace$().$(br2)This step is not required to complete this $(item)Simulation$() but it will speed up your $(item)Steel$() production.
